body:
Interesting, those are not the tests that fail for me locally.
Maybe it depends on machine / storage speed.
Let me merge this after build results from https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1895/3/
Now that HBase 2.6.0 is released, we can resume here?

I ran the following ITs manually:

1. TableTTLIT
2. TTLAsPhoenixTTLIT
3. ViewTTLNotEnabledIT
4. MoveTTLDuringUpgradeIT
Thanks @Divneet18 for your work. @virajjasani @stoty @tkhurana, Please review when you get the chance.
Kicked off a new CI build
Can you rebase @richardantal ? The patch doesn't apply cleanly anymore.
It is based on an old version, from before we removed 2.4.0. support from HEAD.

Also this still uses 2.6.0-SNAPSHOT.
Updating to 2.6.0-hadoop3 should let the CI run fully.
Also update the Phoenix version to 5.3.0-SNAPSHOT in the new compatibility module, I've spent an hour trying to compile it.
CompatOmidTransactionTable also needs to be updated.

I see that hose issues are fixed.

Sorry, I must have used an older patch.

However, most of the checkstyle warnings are relevant.

I'm not sure why the javadoc check failed.
@richardantal  is working on this now.
Only failure is known flapper MutableIndexFailureIT.testIndexWriteFailure

@tkhurana in MetaProperties we are storing ttl as Integer, When conditional TTL will come we are allowed to change condition with Alter!? I think we should move those to String as well. https://github.com/apache/phoenix/blob/6425350bab63c0c52624e48e0f3836fc5a025d56/phoenix-core/src/main/java/org/apache/phoenix/schema/MetaDataClient.java#L5771

@lokiore This PR is not changing the in memory representation. In MetadataClient, currently we take the integer value and then store it as a varchar in syscat. What I am thinking is that ALTER TABLE SET TTL=val where val can be integer or val can be a ttl expression string. I am working on a new way to represent TTL in memory something that can represent both integers and expressions. But that will a subsequent PR which changes how TTL is represented in memory. In syscat it will still be a varchar.
Similarly in PTable, ttl is also an integer for now. We are just converting it to/from the varchar value in syscat.

Does this work fine locally?
`mvn clean javadoc:javadoc -Dskip.code-coverage  -DskipTests=true`

HBase 2.6 support is likely going to land very soon https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1793

Also, 2.4.18 is already released: https://github.com/apache/hbase/releases/tag/rel%2F2.4.18
2.5.9 is about to be released soon.

@jinggou could you please remove `@ignore` for tests and apply logic similar to https://github.com/apache/phoenix/blob/master/phoenix-core/src/it/java/org/apache/phoenix/end2end/index/ReplicationWithWALAnnotationIT.java#L173-L201 ?

For the tests, we will need to keep min versions: 2.6.0, 2.5.9 and 2.4.18. For versions below them, test should be ignored automatically as per the logic.
I haven't reviewed if we really need on-heap cells, I only copied the ensureKeyValue* methods from HBase.

Yes, it works after mvn install.
Yetus should have taken care of that.

The problem is that in Phoenix it is not always clear why we convert to KeyValue.
In some cases it's just lazyness, as we didn't upgrade some internal APIs to Cells.

However, in other cases it's to make sure that we copy off-heap cells to on-heap to avoid use-after-free issues.

Unfortunately, it takes a lot of investigation to separate the two use cases, and no-one has made the time for it yet.
Looks like we need to add support to run tests against 2.6 profile https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-mulitbranch/job/master/688/ ?
Rebased the old [PR](https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1855) to include the PHOENIX-7041 (ADDENDUM-2) - [PR](https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1900/commits)
Yes, opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-7333 for that.
merged manually
merged manually.
Opened PR with JIRA for this

Looks good

merged manually
merged manually.
merged manually.
merged manually.
merged manually.

Thanks @stoty @richardantal for this great work!

Reg the precommit jenkins builds, i just noticed that 2.6 builds are getting aborted (whereas 2.4 and 2.5 builds get failed with few test failures but at least the builds are not aborted).

You mean the multibranch jenkis job, @virajjasani  ?
All precommit builds are running with 2.5 only at the moment.
My bad, yes multibranch builds of master and 5.2
Opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-7339
@ranganathg Changes look good. I will wait for the CI to finish and then merge your PR.
@ranganathg Can you fix the checkstyle errors. They are mostly unsued imports so should be easy fix. Also there is one test failure. Can you try running the test locally ?

> @ranganathg Can you fix the checkstyle errors. They are mostly unsued imports so should be easy fix. Also there is one test failure. Can you try running the test locally ?

fixed the checkstyle. and that test is running fine locally. Thank you.

some code confict with PHOENIX-7001, and it also fix some Statements leak...
so reopen a new PR, origin just closed and give up some code change.

All the latest builds are timing out, aborting or getting much longer to complete. The cause is also not clear and tests are passing locally. We should try breaking `OnDuplicateKeyIT` into two classes: move half of the tests to new class `OnDuplicateKeyIT2`.
This earlier PR #1584 from @gtaparia can be closed?

> This earlier PR #1584 from @gtaparia can be closed?

I have closed the PR @ranganathg

It's still not going well, the latest build is running for almost 6 hr, it will either get aborted or timed out: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1884/21/

can see that the test was running when the `OutOfMemoryError` was thrown from logs: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1884/21/artifact/yetus-general-check/output/patch-unit-root.txt

`[INFO] Running org.apache.phoenix.end2end.OnDuplicateKeyIT`

Latest test report - https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1883/13/testReport/

@virajjasani I think the 3 failing tests are known flappers? If yes, I will go ahead and merge this.
Yes they are known flappers. All yours, go ahead!!

Latest Test Report - https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1919/2/testReport/
Failures are known flappers:
```
 org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.WALRecoveryRegionPostOpenIT.testRecoveryRegionPostOpen
 org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.LoggingHAConnectionLimiterIT.testActivityLogsOnUpsertWhenFailures
org.apache.phoenix.end2end.index.MutableIndexFailureIT.testIndexWriteFailure[MutableIndexFailureIT_transactionProvider=null,localIndex=false,isNamespaceMapped=false,disableIndexOnWriteFailure=true,failRebuildTask=false,throwIndexWriteFailure=null]
```
@palashc Let's wait for the test results before merging
The support for local indexes is not fully working yet and so I converted the PR to a draft PR.
The tests are locally passing for me. The PR is ready for review now.

This PR is an improvement for  PHOENIX-5148 to further optimize `ClientScanPlan` and `ClientAggregatePlan`. It modify `OrderPreservingTracker` to make `OrderPreservingTracker.getOrderPreservingTrackInfos `could also extract partial continuous ordering columns which start from the first column even if `OrderPreservingTracker.isOrderPreserving` is false.

The root cause seems to be 
curl: (6) Could not resolve host: github.com
Trying to open another PR for the same patch

The docker image creation was successful on the identical PR #1929 .
I have no idea why this PR is cursed.

The CI integration seems to be confused:
This is the real CI run: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1929/
merged manually.

@stoty @virajjasani The CI [builds](https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1930/) for this PR are failing with some yetus related errors. Any idea how to resolve this?

When I faced this issue, I have opened another PR with the same changes, and that one worked.
No idea why this happens.

That's what assumeFalse does, @virajjasani .
It disables the test if the HBase version is 2.6.0 or higher.

I see no reason to disable the test when running on HBase versions that can handle the stopped clock.
We already a few similar tests that are only ran with certain HBase versions.

Correct, but in those tests, we usually ignore tests for lower versions because new feature might have dependency on new version HBase clients whereas here we have some buggy behaviour that doesn't work for newer versions. So what I meant is that if anything doesn't work for newer versions, should be marked ignore for all versions because we might either have bug in Phoenix side or HBase side. If test keeps running for older versions, no one might fix it for real :)

But it's fine either way, upto you.

I'm not positive that @Ignore-ing the test results in better chances of it having fixed than only running it for old versions.
I will add a comment explaining the problem, and open a follow-up ticket.
merged manually.

Thanks a lot @stoty @richardantal for getting HBase 2.6 support in and stabilizing tests.
It seems like one last thing we might have to do is adjust client version for 2.6 profile? https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-mulitbranch/job/master/703/testReport/junit/org.apache.phoenix.end2end/BackwardCompatibilityIT/MatrixBuild___Matrix___HBASE_PROFILE____2_6____BuildAndTest___initializationError/

@kadirozde Please take a look at this final PR.
@tkhurana I have incorporated your patch too. Please take a look.

Thank you, looks like you're right.
Opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-7359 to track.

Istvan

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Interesting approach, but this is not really what I had in mind.
IMO the major.minor.patch version is not granular enough for our purposes.

If an upgrade-related bug is found in say, 5.2.0,the user probably does not want to wait for an 5.2.1 to preform the upgrade, but would preferably build a fixed 5.2.0 version, and use that.

This is why I proposed the solution in the ticket.

No, we have never backported 2.6 support to 5.1, much less into 5.1.3.

I think that backporting 2.6 support to 5.1 would be a goodea BTW.
Ah right, my bad
merged manually.
Please also fix the markdownlint error.

Could we introduce an API which always returns a byte array and we simply iterate over the array. That should work regardless whether there is one separator byte or multiple and reduce the amount of code duplication.
@tkhurana, could you help me have a review, thank you very much.
@comnetwork I will take a look.
Awaiting final approval from @stoty

Checkstyle warnings and unit failures are not related. Merging the PR.
Thank you @tkhurana  and @virajjasani  for the review.
`WALRecoveryRegionPostOpenIT#testRecoveryRegionPostOpen` is a known test failure and checkstyle warnings are not related.

@stoty i see that all builds are going to https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/computer/hadoop1/ and the host does not seem healthy as all builds get aborted. What can we do? Can we disconnect the host using jenkins ui? Or shall i inform ASF Infra reg this by creating INFRA Jira?

Yes, the pre-yetus scripts did list and exclude single CI hosts explictily, so that is possible (or at least it was possible at the time).

However, I think that asking for help from INFRA is the way to go, and we should only resort to excluding hosts if infra cannot help with the problem.

Tested locally with 
> mvn clean verify -Dhbase.profile=2.6 -Dit.test=ViewTTLIT\*,ViewTTLWithLongViewIndexEnabledIT\* -Dtest=foo
Note that GlobalIndexCheckerWithRegionMovesIT.testSimulateConcurrentUpdates still fails, but at least the code compiles and runs to completion.
created Jira [INFRA-25995](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-25995)
Note to self: fix the "HConstnants" typo before committing.
Marked Hadoop1 node offline as per recommendation on ASF slack channel asfinfra, now the build is progressing: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1944/
merged manually
